intro: Lepidium owaihiense, commonly known as the Owhaihi native cress, is a small flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are small and white or pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive seed pods that split open when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
